subject: Math
title: Factoring Quadratics - Simple Cases
description: Learn to factor quadratics where a = 1

content.text: Factoring is the reverse of expanding. We want to write x² + bx + c as (x + p)(x + q). This is useful for solving quadratic equations!

content.heading: Factoring x² + bx + c
content.text:
To factor x² + bx + c:
1. Find two numbers that multiply to c
2. Those same numbers must add to b
3. Write as (x + first number)(x + second number)

content.heading: Example 1
solution: Need two numbers that multiply to 12 and add to 7

content.heading: Example 2
solution: Need two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to -5

content.heading: Practice Problems
problems: Factor x² + 5x + 6. What are the two constants? (smaller,larger)
Factor x² + 8x + 15. Sum of the two constants?
Factor x² - 6x + 8. Product of the two constants?
Factor x² - 9x + 20. Sum of the two constants?
